com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices

Class WOWZCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WOWZCamera

  • public class WOWZCamera
extends java.lang.Object
    The WOWZCamera class provides an interface for accessing and controlling a camera device. Use the WOWZCameraView.getDeviceCameras(Context ctx) method to retrieve a list of all cameras.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DIRECTION_BACK
      An identifier for a back-facing camera returned by getDirection().
      static int DIRECTION_FRONT
      An identifier for a front-facing camera returned by getDirection().
      static int DIRECTION_INDETERMINATE
      An identifier for a camera with an indeterminate direction or where direction is not applicable.
      static int FOCUS_MODE_AUTO
      An identifier used with the hasCapability(int) method to detect support for auto focus.
      static int FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS
      An identifier used with the hasCapability(int) method to detect support for continuous video focus.
      static int FOCUS_MODE_OFF
      An identifier used with the setFramerate(int) method to turn off all focus modes.
      static int TORCH
      An identifier used with the hasCapability(int) method to detect the presence of a flash.

      • directionString

        public static java.lang.String directionString(int direction)

      • getNumberOfDeviceCameras

        public static int getNumberOfDeviceCameras(android.content.Context ctx)
        Gets the number of cameras detected on the current device.
        Returns:
        The number of cameras on the current device.

      • getDeviceCameras

        public static WOWZCamera[] getDeviceCameras(boolean availableOnly,
                                            boolean withCapabilities,
                                            android.content.Context ctx)
        Gets an array of WOWZCamera object instances for each camera detected, and optionally accessible, on the current device.
        Parameters:
        availableOnly - If true, the returned array contains instances for only those cameras that could be successfully accessed.
        withCapabilities - If true, queries the camera for its full set of features. This is ordinarily only done the first time the camera is opened for preview. Doing so here can cause performance issues when starting the camera preview.
        Returns:
        An array of WOWZCamera object instances.

      • getDeviceCameras

        public static WOWZCamera[] getDeviceCameras(boolean availableOnly,
                                            android.content.Context ctx)
        Gets an array of WOWZCamera object instances for each camera detected, and optionally accessible, on the current device.
        Parameters:
        availableOnly - If true, the returned array contains instances for only those camera that could be successfully accessed.
        Returns:
        An array of WOWZCamera object instances.

      • getDeviceCameras

        public static WOWZCamera[] getDeviceCameras(android.content.Context ctx)
        Gets an array of WOWZCamera object instances for each camera detected on the current device.
        Returns:
        An array of WOWZCamera object instances.
        See Also:
        for details on the the camera interface.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Checks whether the camera can be opened by the current application.
        Returns:
        True if the camera can be opened; false if an error occurred attempting access.

        Returns:

      • getOptimalPreviewSize

        public WOWZSize getOptimalPreviewSize(WOWZSize requestedSize)
        Gets the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size.
        Parameters:
        requestedSize - The requested frame size for display.
        Returns:
        The best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size.

      • getOptimalPreviewSize

        public WOWZSize getOptimalPreviewSize(WOWZSize requestedSize,
                                      WOWZSize minimumSize)
        Gets the best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size that is equal to or larger than the specified minimum size.
        Parameters:
        requestedSize - The requested frame size for display.
        minimumSize - The minimum frame size to be considered.
        Returns:
        The best frame size supported by the device for previewing video with the specified frame size.

      • hasCapability

        public boolean hasCapability(int capabilityId)
        Shows whether a device has a flash, auto focus mode, or continue focus mode.
        Parameters:
        capabilityId - A specifier indicating the capability, either TORCH, FOCUS_MODE_AUTO, or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS.
        Returns:
        True if the current device supports the specified capability; false otherwise.

      • getFocusMode

        public int getFocusMode()
        Gets the camera's active focus mode.
        Returns:
        FOCUS_MODE_OFF, FOCUS_MODE_AUTO, or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS.

      • setFocusMode

        public void setFocusMode(int focusMode)
        Sets the camera's active focus mode.
        Parameters:
        focusMode - FOCUS_MODE_OFF or FOCUS_MODE_CONTINUOUS.

      • setFocusPoint

        public void setFocusPoint(float x,
                          float y,
                          int focusAreaSize)
        Turns on auto focus mode and sets the focus point to the screen coordinate x, y.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the focus point on the display screen.
        y - The y position of the focus point on the display screen.

      • toViewCoords

        public android.graphics.RectF toViewCoords(android.view.View view,
                                           android.graphics.Rect cameraRect)
        Converts camera coordinates to coordinates for the specified view.
        Parameters:
        view - The view to map.
        cameraRect - A rectangle in camera coordinates.
        Returns:
        A rectangle mapped from the camera coordinates to the view coordinates.
